title: Okay, Riot, there's just under 2 months until halloween.
body:
Make sure your skins are ready.
Make sure 3v3/Hexakill is available.
Make sure there's an Icon available for 1500 IP and 2 others that you get from gifting Harrowing Skins or playing Shadow Isles Champions or playing on Twisted Treeline.

Don't screw us over like last year and release all the Zombie/Zombie Hunter skins after Halloween.

replies.body:
Yea they totally **screwed** us aye! like fuck! **WTF** were we supposed to do! Not having any new halloween skins on the **actual** day! serious? who the fuck would do such a **fucking** cruel thing!!!!

its not like it was a _mild inconvenience_ for the few people who actually bought the skins or anything. Nah they totally fucked us over!

Get the baseball bats boys, lets head over to riot HQ, they screw us, we screw them!

the fuckin nerve of them! can you believe? Mildly inconveniencing us! We'll teach them! 
the **fuckers**!



_______

Seriously? _"Screwed"_ us? 
Time to re-prioritize..
I mean, it's not like it's their job to provide content for their loyal player-base in a timely manner or anything...

Its not their job to provide content **AT ALL**, its a free to play game remember.

anything more than 6 champs and a map is bonus.
Actually, they wouldn't have dev teams if they weren't doing to develop new content. If Riot didn't want to develop new content, they wouldn't be paying the salaries of entire teams.

Yea no one is disputing that. They do pay for teams because they choose to create skins, "choose". its not an obligation, they could choose not to release a skin for en entire year if they wanted.

We get skins they want to make and at the rate that they want to make them, they could easily double their skin production, but they don't because they know the sweet spot of how many to make in a certain time period in order to maximise profits. 

You need to understand that riot is a business, they make a product and sell it, and we have the option to buy it or not to buy it.
Its not a subscription therefore they have no obligation to deliver anything at any given point in time.


Just like a grocery shop has no obligation to sell blueberries when they are in season, they do because it makes them money, but they are under no obligation to put blueberries on the shelves.

So if a supermarket releases all of their halloween costumes and candy after Halloween, that's a good business decision? Or ignoring the fact that they make a good profit from their halloween stock every year and deciding to skip it?

Yeah but we had ocean day. They really need to bring this back too all the free ip got me like 10 champions in the one weekend.

Last year Riot announced that they aren't going to release events such as snowdown and harrowing locked in next to real life seasonal events. [In theory, they could happen any time](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-pbe-feedback/Grefbrd1-a-note-about-the-harrowing). 

>Hey everyone,

>We’re making a few changes around how we roll out seasonal events, story, and featured game modes. As you know, in past seasonal events we’ve released content together (i.e. the Harrowing or Snowdown). Going forward, we’re going to be switching that up a bit and releasing those different types of content separately — like you’ve probably seen on PBE with One For All, Zombie / Slayer skins, and the Shadow Isles champion bios. All of this means seasonal events like the Harrowing and Snowdown will roll out differently than you’ve seen them in the past. **This lets us kick out cool stuff more often without being constrained by specific times of year.**

I'm well aware of this. But they always intended for Harrowing content to be in addition to Halloween content - why else would they have released the Zombie/Slayer skins and the legacy content? Riot just fucked up the timeline for releasing their Halloween content last year.

> **This lets us kick out cool stuff more often without being constrained by specific times of year.**

Rough translation: We're doing Harrowing as well as Halloween 'cos $$.
If there is no Sloth skin I am not interested

It's in Rito's best interests to have the content available when it will have the most sales.
They screwed themselves more than the players, so um, get over it.
